Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இகலென்ப எல்லா உயிர்க்கும் பகலென்னும் பண்பின்மை பாரிக்கும் நோய்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The disease which fosters the evil of disunion among all creatures is termed hatred by the wise.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A dark, sickly, contagious disease ('நோய்') is shown spreading through a community of diverse living beings ('எல்லா உயிர்க்கும்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: This disease, which is Hostility ('இகல்'), has one primary symptom: it causes division and disunion ('பகல்'). Friends are shown turning their backs on each other, families are breaking apart, and cooperation ceases.
Layered_Composition.Background: This disease fosters a fundamental lack of good character ('பண்பின்மை') and spreads it throughout the world, turning a harmonious society into a fractured and hostile one.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Hostility is defined as a disease that infects all life, its main symptom being the creation of division and the destruction of good character.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: Hostility visualized as a literal, spreading plague is the central concept. The act of 'division'—people and animals turning away from each other—is the key visual symptom.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A sickly, ugly, greenish-purple light spreads with the disease, corrupting the otherwise healthy colors of the community.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A high-angle shot that shows the disease of hostility spreading through the community like a plague.

Cultural_Anchors: Hostility as a Disease ('இகல் என்னும் நோய்')

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: a harmonious community, text artifacts, cartoonish.
